notes.note: Performance improvements for faster page loading and stability
Updated interface, including a revamped new tab page that includes top visited sites, and recommendations from Pocket (in the US and Canada)
Video decoding is shut down when the tab playing the media is sent to the background. Video resumes when the tab is brought to the foreground. Audio will not be affected.
Added an option to enable tracking protection outside of private browsing
Automatically enable private mode on compatible keyboards during private browsing
Long URLs in the URL bar are now scrollable

Firefox for Android now supports only extensions built using the WebExtension API, and will deactivate unsupported legacy extensions. [Learn more about our efforts to improve the performance and security of extensions][0]

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/firefox-add-technology-modernizing
Allow Android Apps to launch a customized web browser

## Operating systems
 - Android 4.1
 - Above versions

## Requirements
 - 50 MB internal storage
 - 384 MB of RAM
 - display at least 320 pixels high and 240 pixels wide
text:
Brace yourself for an all-new Firefox. We’ve rebuilt the browser from the ground up, with a  next-generation engine that [clocks in at speeds 2X faster than Firefox 52][0], paired with a clean, modern interface that looks as fast as it feels. Today is the first of several releases we’re calling Firefox Quantum, all designed to get to the things you love and the stuff you need faster than ever before. Experience the difference on desktops running Windows, Mac, and Linux; on Android, speed improvements are landing as well, and both Android and iOS reflect a new [design system][1] that reflects the desktop look and feel. To learn more about Firefox Quantum, visit the Mozilla Blog. 

We'd like to extend a special thank you to all of the [new Mozillians][2] who contributed to this release of Firefox!

[0]: https://mozilla.github.io/arewefastyet-speedometer/2.0/
[1]: http://design.firefox.com/photon/welcome.html
[2]: https://blog.mozilla.org/community/2017/11/09/firefox-57-new-contributors/
title: Firefox for Android 57.0 Release
